thread.title: Lions fall to the Eskimos in overtime
thread.title_full: Lions fall to the Eskimos in overtime - NEWS 1130

author: Rich Brown
title: Lions fall to the Eskimos in overtime
text:
Summary Jonathon Jennings' late interception sealed the Lions fate
Edmonton won its sixth straight game
EDMONTON, AB (NEWS 1130) – Jonathon Jennings was intercepted in double overtime, which led to Sean Whyte’s game-winning field goal as the BC Lions fell 26-23 to the Edmonton Eskimos.
Whyte tied the game for Edmonton with a 16-yard field goal with just three seconds to play in regulation. He gave the Eskimos the lead with another field goal on the opening possession of overtime, but the Lions extended the game with a field goal of their own off the foot of Richie Leone.
The Lions took their first lead of the game in the first quarter when Ronnie Yell stepped in front of a Mike Reilly pass, picked it off and took it back for a touchdown to make it 7-3.
BC’s defense set up another score late in the third quarter. Alex Hoffman-Ellis picked off Reilly to provide the offense with a first and goal from the three-yard line. The Leos quickly converted as Jennings connected with Manny Arceneaux with a touchdown to put them ahead 19-16.
It was the second straight loss for the Lions (5-10), which leaves them just ahead of Winnipeg (5-11) for third place in the West Division standings. Edmonton (12-4) has now won six straight games.
